answer: We forecast a decline in the resolution rate to approximately 42% by the end of the month if no actions are taken.
followup: How can we reduce unresolved cases at month-end, based on insights from a similar dataset?
header: Resolution rate projected to fall to 42% by month-end
indicator: The customer support case resolution rate is forecasted to decline from 65% to 42% by month-end without intervention, missing the 80% target and impacting customer satisfaction.
insight: Without intervention, the resolution rate is expected to drop by over 20 percentage points, from the current 65% to 42%. This decline will likely increase the backlog and reduce customer satisfaction due to slower response times.
plot_summary: Resolution rates are forecasted to decline to 42% by month-end, indicating the need for action to meet the 80% target and prevent backlog growth.
question: Can we predict the end-of-month resolution rate if no changes are made to current processes?
